messages: [{'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-11-27 17:00:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2019-11-28 17:32:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\nThanks Stephen'}, {'account_id': 8770, 'date': '2019-12-04 19:12:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-27 17:00:29.000000000', 'message': 'Add 'is_available' function

Resolves the following warnings seen in the likes of nova:

    DeprecationWarning: Please provide `is_available()` function in your
    custom Eventlet hub <module 'oslo_service' from
    '../oslo_service/__init__.py'>."

    It must return bool: whether hub supports current platform. See
    eventlet/hubs/{epoll,kqueue} for example.

Since we're simply taking the default hub provided by eventlet and
overriding a single attribute, we will always have support so set the
attribute.

Change-Id: I219cf652526802b8212fe8a8f6c499e9aa24a3cf
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add 'is_available' function

Resolves the following warnings seen in the likes of nova:

    DeprecationWarning: Please provide `is_available()` function in your
    custom Eventlet hub <module 'oslo_service' from
    '../oslo_service/__init__.py'>."

    It must return bool: whether hub supports current platform. See
    eventlet/hubs/{epoll,kqueue} for example.

Since we're simply taking the default hub provided by eventlet and
overriding a single attribute, we will always have support so set the
attribute.

Change-Id: I219cf652526802b8212fe8a8f6c499e9aa24a3cf
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Workaround for octavia client API change

This fixes below error:
  module 'octaviaclient.api.v2.octavia' has no attribute 'OctaviaClientException'

The problem fixed here probably appeared after a change
in python-octaviaclient.

RelatedChange: If2565df22c2677bbad09f3eafacc148c740c0124
Story: 2006970
Change-Id: I712957c9f017fee9f2584539b8c8faf574c48e8b

commit_message:
Skip DB table creation and model definition

Since Neutron now creates the database ovn_hash_ring and
ovn_revisio_numbers table as part of [0], networking-ovn needs to be
aware of that and skip the creation if the tables are already present in
the database.

DB models are imported from Neutron.

[0] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/695969

Change-Id: Id625b0abab09fda022be23954ffca453499566bd
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add a limestone-specific label for debugging

Limestone is currently our only ipv6-only provider.  Debugging
issues that only occur in that situation can be difficult depending
on node allocation.  Add a debug label so we can request a limestone
node in these circumstances.

Change-Id: I1e431431779a052ebbacaee1cf2b830fdcb2003a

commit_message:
Fix for getting port groups while using OVS up to 2.9

Functions get_port_group() and get_port_groups() were failing
with KeyError while getting to access non-existent Port_Group
table with OVS 2.9.

This patch adds additional check if Port Group is supported in the
env where the code runs.

Change-Id: If3ce6ab1d1318a6d5142989b3bf45ecce97762e3
Closes-Bug: #1844491
(cherry-picked from commit a78dbc252d97f1e276a45cb8a633a4b17fcef8d7)

commit_message:
Hook resource_tracker to remove stale node information

When we remove a node from a host due to rebalance or decommission,
we need to tell the resource tracker so it stops keeping track of
the details for that node. This adds a hook for doing that and
calls it from the place in compute manager where we purge the
record from the database.

Change-Id: Ie6b6bb2a9e8a4ad33675fccb3827e8197fa16398
Closes-Bug: #1784874
(cherry picked from commit 99db9faae5c1e84e5aa8586c32ffcca7a61ae276)
(cherry picked from commit 7302a625ee9af2c9dd88f8630f1e95fc5977a70a)

commit_message:
Pick between Flat and StrictTwoLevel enforcement

The enforcer needs to be able to determine which model to use and pass
information to it. This commit sets the model attribute on the
enforcer, adds a method to determine which model to use, and
defines a basic interface for enforcement models to use.

Change-Id: Id03d361b702c2ee0811f37ad23bb2b9a3171b1f7
Co-Authored-By: wangxiyuan <wangxiyuan1007@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Lance Bragstad <lbragstad@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: John Garbutt <john.garbutt@stackhpc.com>

This does not accomplish this task, as seen by the fact that the grenae-py3 job ran on PS2.  This is because neutron includes the integrated-gate-networking template which lists grenade-py3 as a job, along with tempest-integrated-networking [1].  I think a full solution for this would be to remove the integrated-gate-networking template from neutron's zuul.yaml and add tempest-integrated-networking directly.

commit_message:
Remove grenade-py3 job from Neutron CI

We have run neutron-grenade-multinode in both check and gate queues
already. This job is almost the same as grenade-py3. The only difference
from Neutron pov is that neutron-grenade-multinode is multinode job and
grenade-py3 is single node job.
So we agreed on last Neutron CI meeting [1], that there is no need to
run both of those jobs.

As grenade-py3 is part of integrated-gate-networking template together
with tempest-integrated-networking job this patch removes also
integrated-gate-networking template from neutron's zuul config and adds
only tempest-integrated-networking to both check and gate queues.

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/neutron_ci/2019/neutron_ci.2019-11-19-16.00.log.html#l-179

Change-Id: Ic2e7ca04929dc89a2e408465eb34ef3feec2e328

commit_message:
Expose baremetal Node.owner

The baremetal API node resource gained the 'owner' field
in the 1.50 microversion. This adds it to the Node resource
in the SDK.

Change-Id: I129fa7f27ffdc82d591c4cf1f23eca46df50e1ba

commit_message:
Add missing format arg for missing g-r reqs

Error message when package not found in the global requirements has
formatting placeholder for the missing package name, but no formatting
was being called to actually populate the name.

Change-Id: Ibf778c61f170fcb798dc93c79c9ab4cdae658c84
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Ensure coordination IDs are encoded

Ensure coordination IDs are encoded when working with coordination
backend. This fixes an issue when upgrading to Python 3 (where bytes
and str are different types) and _update_partitions() attempts to
sort types of 'str' and 'bytes', causing designate-producer to crash.

Change-Id: Id8206ee5285d3a73e00ef21b7d3961a29c23ab4b
Closes-Bug: #1828534

commit_message:
Bump the openstackdocstheme extension to 1.20

Some options are now automatically configured by the version 1.20:
- project
- html_last_updated_fmt
- latex_engine
- latex_elements
- version
- release.

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-18 05:07:48.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes KeyError on volume create/delete

Seems, that cinder changed format of notifications in rocky,
as image_id in glance_metadata is not a list anymore.

Due to this bug agent-notification get stuck and info about
volume delete was not delivered to gnocchi.

Change-Id: Id5a2b3e1fb9aed3e620c8b0e9ffb9cf1a447fea8
Closes-Bug: 1801348
(cherry picked from commit 643f7b5702d6ab676c80a86ef0c730524742b97f)
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes KeyError on volume create/delete

Seems, that cinder changed format of notifications in rocky,
as image_id in glance_metadata is not a list anymore.

Due to this bug agent-notification get stuck and info about
volume delete was not delivered to gnocchi.

Change-Id: Id5a2b3e1fb9aed3e620c8b0e9ffb9cf1a447fea8
Closes-Bug: 1801348
(cherry picked from commit 643f7b5702d6ab676c80a86ef0c730524742b97f)

commit_message:
Compact overly nested css in compressed css

Before:

    # ls -l static/dashboard/css/output.*css
    -rw-r--r-- 1 root root 6925719 Oct 29 15:00 static/dashboard/css/output.28f3a5b9a5de.css
    -rw-r--r-- 1 root root   41082 Oct 29 14:59 static/dashboard/css/output.361cca58bb99.css
    -rw-r--r-- 1 root root 1268980 Oct 29 14:59 static/dashboard/css/output.be235b4cb282.css
    -rw-r--r-- 1 root root     306 Oct 29 14:59 static/dashboard/css/output.fb46d877de44.css

After:

    # ls -l static/dashboard/css/output.*css
    -rw-r--r-- 1 root root    224 Oct 29 14:57 static/dashboard/css/output.28d154fd34de.css
    -rw-r--r-- 1 root root 388079 Oct 29 14:57 static/dashboard/css/output.2bb8178d434f.css
    -rw-r--r-- 1 root root  41082 Oct 29 14:57 static/dashboard/css/output.361cca58bb99.css
    -rw-r--r-- 1 root root 242717 Oct 29 14:57 static/dashboard/css/output.d2683889a5b6.css

I.e. 12x smaller.

Change-Id: I2715c6573f1c84bbba64e9e850421b54003b80da
See: https://github.com/Kronuz/pyScss/issues/243

[{'created': '2019-11-27 13:22:24.000000000', 'message': 'Propose Large Scale SIG

During a forum session in Shanghai around the opportunity to create
a SIG around large scale issues, there was a critical mass of people
interested in participating in such a group. The Large Scale SIG held
its first meeting on November 27.

Change-Id: I2e4be272b22c99f9c4b46c3a5bf04d64e32536d9
'}]
commit_message:
Propose Large Scale SIG

During a forum session in Shanghai around the opportunity to create
a SIG around large scale issues, there was a critical mass of people
interested in participating in such a group. The Large Scale SIG held
its first meeting on November 27.

Change-Id: I2e4be272b22c99f9c4b46c3a5bf04d64e32536d9

commit_message:
Add feature gate capability to OSH-Infra

This patch set adds the feature gate capability to OpenStack-Helm-Infra
repository without depending on the main OpenStack-Helm repository.

Change-Id: I70b8fac4fd2365f8eedcf50519f125eb34534f2f
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tlam@omegaprime.dev>
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>

commit_message:
Replace hiera('service_names') by hiera('enabled_services')

In the effort of reducing the number of Hieradata files, the
service_names parameter previously consummed in puppet-tripleo can be
replaced by enabled_services which contains the same list.

It will allow us later to remove the service_names hieradata file.

Change-Id: I457f2c81a2cf6cc2f42dc4585b41b0d91dacc059
Related-Bug: #1835551

commit_message:
Stop using six library

Since we've dropped support for Python 2.7, it's time to look at
the bright future that Python 3.x will bring and stop forcing
compatibility with older versions.
This patch removes the six library from requirements, not
looking back.

Change-Id: I73e8f81041a31501215be99f6ab0f05afc03e06a

commit_message:
Stop using six library

Since we've dropped support for Python 2.7, it's time to look at
the bright future that Python 3.x will bring and stop forcing
compatibility with older versions.
This patch removes the six library from requirements, not
looking back.

Change-Id: I19384db89fc2a68376efc3f9f2e05fbd05046fd6

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-03 20:11:28.000000000', 'message': 'Add QoS tempest config so bw tests run

In [1] the tempest-slow-py3 job was dropped and non-redundant bits
folded into the nova-next job.

Except we forgot to move over some of the config necessary to make this
QoS bandwidth test [2] work, so it gets skipped:

setUpClass (tempest.scenario.test_minbw_allocation_placement.MinBwAllocationPlacementTest)
... SKIPPED: Skipped as no physnet is available in config for placement based QoS allocation.

This syncs the nova-next job with the config like what was done for
tempest-slow here [3]. Some of that was already in place (to make
QoS heal allocation testing work).

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/683988/
[2] https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/3eb3c29e979fd3f13c205d62119748952d63054a/tempest/scenario/test_minbw_allocation_placement.py#L142
[3] https://github.com/openstack/tempest/commit/c87a06b3c29427dc8f2513047c804e0410b4b99c

Change-Id: Ib9332b8677c4ccb9e38b6fcdf39e989a891a56fe
'}, {'created': '2019-12-03 20:19:26.000000000', 'message': 'Add QoS tempest config so bw tests run

folded into the nova-next job.

QoS bandwidth test [2] work, so it gets skipped:

... SKIPPED: Skipped as no physnet is available in config for placement based QoS allocation.

This syncs the nova-next job with the config like what was done for
tempest-slow here [3]. Some of that was already in place (to make
QoS heal allocation testing work).

commit_message:
Add QoS tempest config so bw tests run

In [1] the tempest-slow-py3 job was dropped and non-redundant bits
folded into the nova-next job.

Except we forgot to move over some of the config necessary to make this
QoS bandwidth test [2] work, so it gets skipped:

setUpClass (tempest.scenario.test_minbw_allocation_placement.MinBwAllocationPlacementTest)
... SKIPPED: Skipped as no physnet is available in config for placement based QoS allocation.

This syncs the nova-next job with the config like what was done for
tempest-slow here [3]. Some of that was already in place (to make
QoS heal allocation testing work).

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/683988/
[2] https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/3eb3c29e979fd3f13c205d62119748952d63054a/tempest/scenario/test_minbw_allocation_placement.py#L142
[3] https://github.com/openstack/tempest/commit/c87a06b3c29427dc8f2513047c804e0410b4b99c

Closes-Bug: #1854993

Change-Id: Ib9332b8677c4ccb9e38b6fcdf39e989a891a56fe

commit_message:
Disable ceph dashboard to fix upstream ci

This review just disable ceph-dashboard on scenario001 since
the last promoted ceph-ansible contains a task with a command
that seems not provided yet by the ceph container current build.
The patch can be reverted after a new ceph container tag will
be created.

Related-Bug: #1849274
Change-Id: I7dbad26cef9c1cf9c68610d6d06e0f212241cf75

commit_message:
Change openstack clients install directive

This change switches to using the python_packages *1 layer.yaml
directive for installing the openstack clients for use by the
charm. This is primarily to work around *2

*1 https://charmsreactive.readthedocs.io/en/latest/layer-basic.html#layer-configuration
*2 https://github.com/juju-solutions/layer-basic/issues/149

Change-Id: I618235384164c03776bd25bf669543fbd99794ad

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-27 18:32:38.000000000', 'message': 'Fix FC scan too broad

After some changes to the FC connector we have introduced a regression
on the way we do the scans, and we end up scanning using wildcards even
though we shouldn't.

The targets in the "initiator_target_map" don't mean that they are all
connected, so we must take that into account.

With the current code, if we have the following connections:

HBA host7 ---- SWITCH ---- port W (channel 0, target 2)
\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\--- SWITCH ---- port X (channel 0, target 3)

HBA host8 ---- SWITCH ---- port Y (channel 0, target 2)
\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\--- SWITCH ---- port Z (channel 0, target 3)

We will end up with the following scans 8 scans for LUN L:

\xa0\xa0- - L > host7
\xa0\xa0- - L > host7
\xa0\xa00 2 L > host7
\xa0\xa00 3 L > host7

\xa0\xa00 2 L > host8
\xa0\xa00 3 L > host8
\xa0\xa0- - L > host8
\xa0\xa0- - L > host8

Which correspond to the responses from _get_hba_channel_scsi_target like
this:

\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0port Y          port Z          port W          port X
\xa0\xa0host7 ... ['-','-',L]     ['-','-',L]     ['0','2',L]     ['0','3',L]
\xa0\xa0host8 ... ['0','2',L]     ['0','3',L]     ['-','-',L]     ['-','-',L]

And we should only be doing 4 scans:

\xa0\xa00 2 L > host7
\xa0\xa00 3 L > host7
\xa0\xa00 2 L > host8
\xa0\xa00 3 L > host8

Most storage arrays get their target ports automatically detected by the
Linux FC initiator and sysfs gets populated with that information, but
there are some that don't.

We'll do a narrow scan using the channel, target, and LUN for the former
and a wider scan for the latter.

If all paths to a former type of array were down on the system boot the
array could look like it's of the latter type and make us bring us
unwanted volumes into the system by doing a broad scan.

To prevent this from happening Cinder drivers can use the
"enable_wildcard_scan" key in the connection information to let us know
they don't want us to do broad scans even if no target ports are found
(because they know the cause is there's no connection).

Close-Bug: #1849504
Related-Bug: #1765000
Related-Bug: #1828440
Change-Id: I5dbefaff43fb902b15117b443fc92f7b6a6ad8c9
(cherry picked from commit 708733e49598145eb8e898d486723dc3df00a52f)
(cherry picked from commit c76b6dc514b8e17e1211e4a7465a7e2a635adea3)
(cherry picked from commit 8933503041529978b9fd816e1788b1b0c343b540)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix FC scan too broad

After some changes to the FC connector we have introduced a regression
on the way we do the scans, and we end up scanning using wildcards even
though we shouldn't.

The targets in the "initiator_target_map" don't mean that they are all
connected, so we must take that into account.

With the current code, if we have the following connections:

HBA host7 ---- SWITCH ---- port W (channel 0, target 2)
          \--- SWITCH ---- port X (channel 0, target 3)

HBA host8 ---- SWITCH ---- port Y (channel 0, target 2)
          \--- SWITCH ---- port Z (channel 0, target 3)

We will end up with the following scans 8 scans for LUN L:

  - - L > host7
  - - L > host7
  0 2 L > host7
  0 3 L > host7

  0 2 L > host8
  0 3 L > host8
  - - L > host8
  - - L > host8

Which correspond to the responses from _get_hba_channel_scsi_target like
this:

               port Y          port Z          port W          port X
  host7 ... ['-','-',L]     ['-','-',L]     ['0','2',L]     ['0','3',L]
  host8 ... ['0','2',L]     ['0','3',L]     ['-','-',L]     ['-','-',L]

And we should only be doing 4 scans:

  0 2 L > host7
  0 3 L > host7
  0 2 L > host8
  0 3 L > host8

Most storage arrays get their target ports automatically detected by the
Linux FC initiator and sysfs gets populated with that information, but
there are some that don't.

We'll do a narrow scan using the channel, target, and LUN for the former
and a wider scan for the latter.

If all paths to a former type of array were down on the system boot the
array could look like it's of the latter type and make us bring us
unwanted volumes into the system by doing a broad scan.

To prevent this from happening Cinder drivers can use the
"enable_wildcard_scan" key in the connection information to let us know
they don't want us to do broad scans even if no target ports are found
(because they know the cause is there's no connection).

Close-Bug: #1849504
Related-Bug: #1765000
Related-Bug: #1828440
Change-Id: I5dbefaff43fb902b15117b443fc92f7b6a6ad8c9
(cherry picked from commit 708733e49598145eb8e898d486723dc3df00a52f)
(cherry picked from commit c76b6dc514b8e17e1211e4a7465a7e2a635adea3)
(cherry picked from commit 8933503041529978b9fd816e1788b1b0c343b540)

commit_message:
build: remove link to failed log before creating

Kolla allows to create separate logs per image. It also makes very
useful symlinks to those builds which fail.

But it fails to do that on next builds:

ERROR:kolla.common.utils:aodh-base Failed with status: error
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "./tools/build.py", line 40, in <module>
    sys.exit(main())
  File "./tools/build.py", line 30, in main
    statuses = build.run_build()
  File "/home/hrw/devel/kolla/kolla/image/build.py", line 1333, in run_build
    results = kolla.summary()
  File "/home/hrw/devel/kolla/kolla/image/build.py", line 1037, in summary
    "000_FAILED_%s.log" % name))
FileExistsError: [Errno 17] File exists: 'aodh-base.log' -> 'logs/debian-source-buster/000_FAILED_aodh-base.log'

Change-Id: I85132bbace63c8b386f69ddb758a3b52e52c0ef0
(cherry picked from commit 5792c1d7b44737f1f39bb1a81b0c95207ad087ad)

commit_message:
Fix cert_manager_api with x509keypair

When magnum is using x509keypair as backend
the db query fails to apply the tenant filters
due to the missing context.

Pass the context to the the cert_manager.

story: 2006897
task: 37533

Change-Id: Ifdedac420fe4384013704865fa05ea6f1c15feb5
Signed-off-by: Spyros Trigazis <spyridon.trigazis@cern.ch>
(cherry picked from commit 0205534f90e8b75d519579254749f6019b0faafa)

commit_message:
Allow for router resource without 'routes' attribute

The 'routes' attribute is optional, so allow for Neutron plugins that
do not provide it.

Change-Id: I55deab0c640b718e811d2c4573dbd02152bea076

commit_message:
Don't require provider_networks with no_containers

When no_containers is set in global_overrides it means that it's going
to be metal deployment. Since metal deployments do not require
provider_networks, we can easily skip check of their existance in
openstack_user_config.yml

Change-Id: Ie12d13f5eb90bc4fbb4bf73e2d5915b1493e819d

messages: [{'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2019-12-04 10:19:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2019-12-04 10:19:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked\n\nThis patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/stein as commit 021f55b2fa7b66aa37d2859331e48b1383474da7'}, {'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2019-12-04 10:20:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2019-12-04 10:22:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2019-12-04 10:26:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Review-Priority+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-04 10:19:53.000000000', 'message': "Fix Swift with kernel 4.19 and later

We mount Swift volumes with xfs.
The 'nobarrier' option we used was made noop [1]
and deprecated [2] (with warning) in kernel 4.10.
In 4.19 it was removed [3] resulting in an error
when using e.g. Debian Buster as host.
The noop patch was backported to CentOS 7 so
it is safe to remove this option with no behavior
change and backport to where needed.
Ubuntu Bionic uses 4.15 which only warns.
CentOS 8 uses 4.18 which only warns as well.
Debian Buster uses 4.19 exactly which breaks.

[1] https://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/commit/?id=2291dab2c9d1880efd19469df2042e2277c8b7a4
[2] https://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/commit/?id=4cf4573d899cd80d8578c050061dc342f99f3a32
[3] https://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/commit/?id=1c02d502c20809a2a5f71ec16a930a61ed779b81

Change-Id: I006dea21321146c7fc738d0b41c401b72d271a99
Closes-bug: #1800132
(cherry picked from commit 21488710d68450eac4ace21bea4c5f929e0189d4)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix Swift with kernel 4.19 and later

We mount Swift volumes with xfs.
The 'nobarrier' option we used was made noop [1]
and deprecated [2] (with warning) in kernel 4.10.
In 4.19 it was removed [3] resulting in an error
when using e.g. Debian Buster as host.
The noop patch was backported to CentOS 7 so
it is safe to remove this option with no behavior
change and backport to where needed.
Ubuntu Bionic uses 4.15 which only warns.
CentOS 8 uses 4.18 which only warns as well.
Debian Buster uses 4.19 exactly which breaks.

[1] https://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/commit/?id=2291dab2c9d1880efd19469df2042e2277c8b7a4
[2] https://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/commit/?id=4cf4573d899cd80d8578c050061dc342f99f3a32
[3] https://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/commit/?id=1c02d502c20809a2a5f71ec16a930a61ed779b81

Change-Id: I006dea21321146c7fc738d0b41c401b72d271a99
Closes-bug: #1800132
(cherry picked from commit 21488710d68450eac4ace21bea4c5f929e0189d4)

commit_message:
Do not update/delete ports upon inspection of active nodes

Short-circuit the port update logic for active nodes to allow only
for the addition of new ports.

Story: #2006956
Task: #37645

Change-Id: Ifd870a8465b6643578299dc86e2eae023db6ae43

from the port list when inspecting active nodes,

commit_message:
[OVN] Move extensions.py

Previous paths in networking-ovn tree:
./networking_ovn/common/extensions.py -> ./neutron/extensions/ovn.py

The patch also updates the DevStack module to consume the extensions
list from the neutron repository.

Change-Id: I302c85fcc3cbd24d48f89e91c62756f6a2a5342e
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-04 10:19:58.000000000', 'message': "Fix Swift with kernel 4.19 and later

We mount Swift volumes with xfs.
The 'nobarrier' option we used was made noop [1]
and deprecated [2] (with warning) in kernel 4.10.
In 4.19 it was removed [3] resulting in an error
when using e.g. Debian Buster as host.
The noop patch was backported to CentOS 7 so
it is safe to remove this option with no behavior
change and backport to where needed.
Ubuntu Bionic uses 4.15 which only warns.
CentOS 8 uses 4.18 which only warns as well.
Debian Buster uses 4.19 exactly which breaks.

[1] https://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/commit/?id=2291dab2c9d1880efd19469df2042e2277c8b7a4
[2] https://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/commit/?id=4cf4573d899cd80d8578c050061dc342f99f3a32
[3] https://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/commit/?id=1c02d502c20809a2a5f71ec16a930a61ed779b81

Change-Id: I006dea21321146c7fc738d0b41c401b72d271a99
Closes-bug: #1800132
(cherry picked from commit 21488710d68450eac4ace21bea4c5f929e0189d4)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix Swift with kernel 4.19 and later

We mount Swift volumes with xfs.
The 'nobarrier' option we used was made noop [1]
and deprecated [2] (with warning) in kernel 4.10.
In 4.19 it was removed [3] resulting in an error
when using e.g. Debian Buster as host.
The noop patch was backported to CentOS 7 so
it is safe to remove this option with no behavior
change and backport to where needed.
Ubuntu Bionic uses 4.15 which only warns.
CentOS 8 uses 4.18 which only warns as well.
Debian Buster uses 4.19 exactly which breaks.

[1] https://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/commit/?id=2291dab2c9d1880efd19469df2042e2277c8b7a4
[2] https://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/commit/?id=4cf4573d899cd80d8578c050061dc342f99f3a32
[3] https://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/commit/?id=1c02d502c20809a2a5f71ec16a930a61ed779b81

Change-Id: I006dea21321146c7fc738d0b41c401b72d271a99
Closes-bug: #1800132
(cherry picked from commit 21488710d68450eac4ace21bea4c5f929e0189d4)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-03 19:53:34.000000000', 'message': "Fix missing deep_compare for fence_redfish

Agent generator doesn't seem to work for fence_redfish, so this
was missing in https://review.opendev.org/#/c/679407/.

This commit adds deep_compare and update_settle_secs.

Change-Id: Ibb87428fce4026b21032f874feb09104cca0db52
"}, {'created': '2019-12-04 08:18:13.000000000', 'message': 'Fix missing deep_compare for fence_redfish

Fence_redfish was blacklisted from the automatic agent generation by:

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/636886/

and unfortunately https://review.opendev.org/#/c/679407/ did not take
that into account.

This commit adds deep_compare and update_settle_secs manually until we
can revert that change.

Resolves: rhbz#1699449

Change-Id: Ibb87428fce4026b21032f874feb09104cca0db52
'}]
commit_message:
Fix missing deep_compare for fence_redfish

Fence_redfish was blacklisted from the automatic agent generation by:

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/636886/

and unfortunately https://review.opendev.org/#/c/679407/ did not take
that into account.

This commit adds deep_compare and update_settle_secs manually until we
can revert that change.

Resolves: rhbz#1699449

Change-Id: Ibb87428fce4026b21032f874feb09104cca0db52

Remove qemu packages to run Leapp upgrade with rhos-release.

Executing the Leapp upgrade with rhos-release requires
to have these two packages removed, otherwise leapp
upgrade fails.

messages: [{'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2019-12-03 17:16:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2019-12-04 08:11:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2019-12-04 08:12:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck so many random failures in the last days'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-03 17:16:22.000000000', 'message': "Stop trying to power off nodes if manage_boot is False

When manage_boot is False, we do not power on the machines on starting
introspection, nor do we power them off on aborting. We should not
power off on finishing introspection either, let's leave it up to ironic.

Change-Id: If8115f8d592e1b24b07ef52bcd703d10763c1f00
Story: #1528920
(cherry picked from commit 85267e881c4aaa83511a247d28693600dc8ced94)
"}]
commit_message:
Stop trying to power off nodes if manage_boot is False

When manage_boot is False, we do not power on the machines on starting
introspection, nor do we power them off on aborting. We should not
power off on finishing introspection either, let's leave it up to ironic.

Change-Id: If8115f8d592e1b24b07ef52bcd703d10763c1f00
Story: #1528920
(cherry picked from commit 85267e881c4aaa83511a247d28693600dc8ced94)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-29 07:57:12.000000000', 'message': 'CI: Refactor a lot

Separate upgrade logic to is_upgrade job var and rename
scenarios to match.

Rename "ACTION" to "SCENARIO" (as it is a scenario).

Separate testing of dashboard (aka Horizon) and increase
its timeout to 5 minutes (CentOS 7 slow as always).

Separate initialization of core OpenStack.

Use gate setup script from ./tests/

Remove useless tox setupenv.

Do not deploy Heat when not really necessary.

Change-Id: I4fca319ccc3de7188f8b7b44c9c71321e3899467
(cherry picked from commit a2fc684164cb5169492d6e0c007ad006f814492c)
'}]
commit_message:
CI: Refactor a lot

Separate upgrade logic to is_upgrade job var and rename
scenarios to match.

Rename "ACTION" to "SCENARIO" (as it is a scenario).

Separate testing of dashboard (aka Horizon) and increase
its timeout to 5 minutes (CentOS 7 slow as always).

Separate initialization of core OpenStack.

Use gate setup script from ./tests/

Remove useless tox setupenv.

Do not deploy Heat when not really necessary.

Change-Id: I4fca319ccc3de7188f8b7b44c9c71321e3899467
(cherry picked from commit a2fc684164cb5169492d6e0c007ad006f814492c)

commit_message:
debian: install more things from backports

We were installing udev/systemd from backports by selecting which
package to get. But with systemd 241-5~bpo9+1 update we need more.

And then we need newer iptables due to dependencies.

Change-Id: Ifc075a0142738deb65fa3c73460b57cad61a5d4b

commit_message:
Sync 'validations/library/ini.py' with the validations framework

Ibd1e54b2d2748b3bf8d2c1cabad3a9faf832e9b2 introduced a new "default"
parameter to the "ini" module allowing to return a success (with a
default value) even if the key isn't found in the file.

This patch also synchronizes the ctlplane-ip-range validation in the
validations directory.

Change-Id: I5e3fd6286c8f65586416b75472678bacfa5a4cd6
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

subject: Fix Swift with kernel 4.19 and later
messages: [{'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2019-12-04 10:20:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch stable/stein.'}, {'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2019-12-04 10:20:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2019-12-04 10:22:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-04 10:20:04.000000000', 'message': "Fix Swift with kernel 4.19 and later

We mount Swift volumes with xfs.
The 'nobarrier' option we used was made noop [1]
and deprecated [2] (with warning) in kernel 4.10.
In 4.19 it was removed [3] resulting in an error
when using e.g. Debian Buster as host.
The noop patch was backported to CentOS 7 so
it is safe to remove this option with no behavior
change and backport to where needed.
Ubuntu Bionic uses 4.15 which only warns.
CentOS 8 uses 4.18 which only warns as well.
Debian Buster uses 4.19 exactly which breaks.

[1] https://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/commit/?id=2291dab2c9d1880efd19469df2042e2277c8b7a4
[2] https://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/commit/?id=4cf4573d899cd80d8578c050061dc342f99f3a32
[3] https://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/commit/?id=1c02d502c20809a2a5f71ec16a930a61ed779b81

Change-Id: I006dea21321146c7fc738d0b41c401b72d271a99
Closes-bug: #1800132
(cherry picked from commit 21488710d68450eac4ace21bea4c5f929e0189d4)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix Swift with kernel 4.19 and later

We mount Swift volumes with xfs.
The 'nobarrier' option we used was made noop [1]
and deprecated [2] (with warning) in kernel 4.10.
In 4.19 it was removed [3] resulting in an error
when using e.g. Debian Buster as host.
The noop patch was backported to CentOS 7 so
it is safe to remove this option with no behavior
change and backport to where needed.
Ubuntu Bionic uses 4.15 which only warns.
CentOS 8 uses 4.18 which only warns as well.
Debian Buster uses 4.19 exactly which breaks.

[1] https://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/commit/?id=2291dab2c9d1880efd19469df2042e2277c8b7a4
[2] https://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/commit/?id=4cf4573d899cd80d8578c050061dc342f99f3a32
[3] https://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/commit/?id=1c02d502c20809a2a5f71ec16a930a61ed779b81

Change-Id: I006dea21321146c7fc738d0b41c401b72d271a99
Closes-bug: #1800132
(cherry picked from commit 21488710d68450eac4ace21bea4c5f929e0189d4)

causing the pod creation to timeout. This commit fixes the
issue by ensuring the namespace is properly wired by Kuryr,
to then try the Pod creation, reducing the timeout chances.

commit_message:
Reduce flakiness of pod creation timeout

As this test recreates the namespace and a pod on it,
it could take a bit longer for the older KuryrNet CRD
to be removed and recreated, plus the pool to be populated
causing the pod creation to timeout. This commit reduce the
flakiness by increasing the timeout.

Change-Id: I31a874c5f1d0d134e555a32b09a71e9466daea77

commit_message:
Ensure no directory listing is active

By default, puppetlabs-apache module enables Indexes option, which can
lead in data/structure leak.

The following patch disable that option on a global base, since we
shouldn't need such a feature.

Closes-Bug: #1854442
Change-Id: Icba53f4e32237556608f4cb6dcd9da1a71705c19

commit_message:
Provide short description for cryptic team names

Looking at https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/projects/index.html
certain team names are not self-explaining. The "service" field
is generally used to clarify in a short description what the team
provides. This patch adds short descriptions for the teams where the
name is not self-explaining (including "requirements" which can be
confusing at first glance).

Change-Id: I24fce9a46cfed8ebf2dfcb4fd7cf5ac87bf2500b

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-29 07:45:55.000000000', 'message': "Fix neutron api TLS logging

This is a partial cherry pick (logging part) of
Ia1c22b8981fb735a052707516f73313c4e5ca93c
Closes-Bug: #1852779

Namely it is the second part of the commit only:
B) The logging in the neutron_server_tls_proxy container is not persisted to the host

Before:
[root@controller-0 ~]# ls -l /var/log/containers/httpd/neutron-api/
[root@controller-0 ~]#

After:
[root@controller-0 ~]# ls -l /var/log/containers/httpd/neutron-api/
total 136
-rw-r--r--. 1 root root   400 Nov 15 17:43 error_log
-rw-r--r--. 1 root root 72784 Nov 15 17:53 neutron-api-proxy_access_ssl.log
-rw-r--r--. 1 root root  2748 Nov 15 17:43 neutron-api-proxy_error_ssl.log
[root@controller-0 ~]#

We backport only the logging bit because this needs to be fixed all the
way to queens which did not have the ovn-tls work from Kamil.
(I should have split this neutron api TLS fixes in two commits in the
first place, but it's too late for that)

Change-Id: Id9b9a15d40467507bdeace56be55b63a6298b560
"}]
commit_message:
Fix neutron api TLS logging

This is a partial cherry pick (logging part) of
Ia1c22b8981fb735a052707516f73313c4e5ca93c
Closes-Bug: #1852779

Namely it is the second part of the commit only:
B) The logging in the neutron_server_tls_proxy container is not persisted to the host

Before:
[root@controller-0 ~]# ls -l /var/log/containers/httpd/neutron-api/
[root@controller-0 ~]#

After:
[root@controller-0 ~]# ls -l /var/log/containers/httpd/neutron-api/
total 136
-rw-r--r--. 1 root root   400 Nov 15 17:43 error_log
-rw-r--r--. 1 root root 72784 Nov 15 17:53 neutron-api-proxy_access_ssl.log
-rw-r--r--. 1 root root  2748 Nov 15 17:43 neutron-api-proxy_error_ssl.log
[root@controller-0 ~]#

We backport only the logging bit because this needs to be fixed all the
way to queens which did not have the ovn-tls work from Kamil.
(I should have split this neutron api TLS fixes in two commits in the
first place, but it's too late for that)

Change-Id: Id9b9a15d40467507bdeace56be55b63a6298b560

subject: ci: check for proper retirement
messages:
[{'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2019-07-06 17:36:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2019-07-06 17:36:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2019-07-06 18:19:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Does removing a repo from governance always imply that it is being fully retired? Does that mean I couldn't, for example, take stevedore out of the Oslo team repo list and maintain it myself on GitHub? (Not that I want to, that's just an example.)"}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2019-07-06 18:21:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Does removing a repo from governance always imply that it is being
 > fully retired? Does that mean I couldn't, for example, take
 > stevedore out of the Oslo team repo list and maintain it myself on
 > GitHub? (Not that I want to, that's just an example.)

I suppose I should have actually asked if I could maintain it on opendev.org just not under the Oslo program. Moving to GitHub would make deleting the content here more obviously desirable."}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2019-07-06 18:33:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I thought a little bit about that in advance, in this case, we're actually specifically checking for openstack/<foo>

If you move openstack/stevedore to dhellmann/stevedore on opendev, the entry for retirement will still be there, and ideally openstack/stevedore would include a commit with a README saying it's no longer maintained there?

As an example: https://opendev.org/openstack/gnocchi"}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-07-08 05:43:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

This check is too aggressive, it catches the cases that Doug mentions: A repo is moved out of governance but still maintained in OpenDev infrastructure. Some examples are fuel repos, networking repos, or api-site. Moving them out of governance is *not* retiring. The way the governance repo is set up, it handles both the same.

So, -1 on this change.

You could differentiate the two cases in legacy.yaml and add another flag and test for that one...'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2019-07-08 16:36:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

This is pretty confusing, I always thought a retired project is a retired project, not one that left OpenStack.

Should retired projects be renamed out of openstack/ ?'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-07-08 16:37:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

A retired project is retired ;) 

But legacy.yaml lists not only retired repos but also repos that are moved out of governance.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-07-08 16:38:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

First lines of legacy.yaml:

# List of projects that were previously official, and have been dropped from
# the official list.  We track these temporarily to manage voter rolls.  When a
# no-longer-official project has been delisted long enough that its
# contributors are no longer eligible to vote, the associated entry should be
# removed from this file.'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2019-07-08 16:41:32.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from ci/check-retired to code-change'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-12-04 12:06:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I will leave this open, as I understand the context, and I like the concept.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-12-04 12:08:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> I will leave this open, as I understand the context, and I like the
 > concept.

Posted too early... Here is what is missing:

"Howver, as I don't have time right now, I suggest to temporarily abandon it, and anyone with the time could re-open it."'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-12-04 12:08:10.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
ci: check for proper retirement

This will check that a repository is properly retired by making
sure that it only contains a README (and optionally a .gitreview
file).

This will make sure that we enforce the process we agreed to that
we won't retire a project until the code is officially gone.

Change-Id: Ib5a5c48131603effeed4e967f4ff6057b73bc712

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-26 20:39:28.000000000', 'message': "Document the chair's prerogative to continue debate

At the PTG we discussed how the chair should handle situations where
there are multiple incompatible patches that each have, on paper,
sufficient votes to be merged. Discussion turned to broader principles
of how we want to operate by consensus, without putting the chair in a
position where they never know if they are authorised to merge a patch
or not. This change to the house rules captures the outcome of that
discussion.

Change-Id: I6187a3ca4ad0438890a8aa88f5228876afd76d43
"}]
commit_message:
Document the chair's prerogative to continue debate

At the PTG we discussed how the chair should handle situations where
there are multiple incompatible patches that each have, on paper,
sufficient votes to be merged. Discussion turned to broader principles
of how we want to operate by consensus, without putting the chair in a
position where they never know if they are authorised to merge a patch
or not. This change to the house rules captures the outcome of that
discussion.

Change-Id: I6187a3ca4ad0438890a8aa88f5228876afd76d43

[{'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2019-09-05 13:21:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-09-05 13:30:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

Seems a little late to be changing guidance on this for train at this point.

Does tempest really need to stick with 3.5? The services need to run under 3.5 for those older branches, but tempest itself shouldn't really matter. Or is the concern that if we don't continue to support 3.5, the user may need to install a newer version of tempest to be able to run the tempest tests?"}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2019-09-05 14:00:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > Seems a little late to be changing guidance on this for train at
 > this point.
 > 
 > Does tempest really need to stick with 3.5? The services need to
 > run under 3.5 for those older branches, but tempest itself
 > shouldn't really matter. Or is the concern that if we don't
 > continue to support 3.5, the user may need to install a newer
 > version of tempest to be able to run the tempest tests?

It actually needs to support otherwise we may break stable branch testing. It is not a new addition, it is to mention explicitly. While dropping the support of py3.5 in Stein and updating the Train runtime we have not removed the py3.5 support from Tempest or any of its plugin."}, {'account_id': 10607, 'date': '2019-09-09 11:45:13.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to documentation-update'}, {'account_id': 10607, 'date': '2019-09-09 11:45:24.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from documentation-update to documentation-change'}, {'account_id': 10607, 'date': '2019-09-09 11:45:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1

Tempest is testing. For all that matters, it could be in go or rust. That shouldn't have any impact on the ecosystem as a whole like service, clients, libraries, or deployment  projects.

I am confused why we want an explicit TC overrule to say that tempest is an exception.

Tempest is master of its destiny. If tempest is using python, then it should follow the python guidelines. But it doesn't prevent ensuring stability for older releases if the project decides so."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-09-12 13:17:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I agree with this position. We don't need to have governance level declarations for every project variation."}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2019-09-17 14:47:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Along with OpenStack services official supported python version, if we add the officially supported version of OpenStack testing tools then it will help Tempest users to understand that Train version of Tempest can be run against python2.7 cloud.

I am not seeing any harm to say about officially supported python version for the testing tool because it is not same as OpenStack services."}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2019-09-17 14:48:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

This is not each project variation this is about OpenStack testing tool supported versions along with services supported version."}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2019-09-18 02:32:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote-1

commit_message:
Add Tempest and Plugins req in Train tested Runtime

Tempest and Temepst Plugins are branchless and their
master code test the supported stable branches. This
makes them to keep testing the older Python version
also. For exmaple, they need to keep testing py3.5 also.

Let's mention that explicitly to make it clear.

Change-Id: I0a6842e27dc376134ffa3c393cd90fdb1158ca52

Meh, this is fine. It seems unnecessary, already pretty clear in the document. The problems this time around would likely have occurred even with this wording.'}, {'account_id': 10607, 'date': '2019-08-21 15:42:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

I agree with Eric, I'm not sure this clarification solves the problem. Could you be more verbose on how you see this clarification solving what happened for U?"}, {'account_id': 8099, 'date': '2019-08-21 15:43:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I am neither +/- on this - if we stay with the status quo this could be an OK refinement, but as Eric pointed out, I am pretty sure that this would not have been followed even with this clarification'}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2019-08-21 16:33:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Honestly, of all the changes, I really don't like this one. I feel as though the mechanism for naming needs to shift more than "clarify the existing release naming process".

I was extremely underwhelmed by the U name process to the point where I felt as though none of the names on the poll were worth voting for. This is a reflection of the situation around the process not the names themselves. 

I am a fan of almost any other of Jim's proposed changes (the "stop naming change" would need some refinement).'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-08-21 16:39:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

 > where I felt as though none of the names on the poll were worth
 > voting for. This is a reflection of the situation around the
 > process not the names themselves.
 > 
 > I am a fan of almost any other of Jim's proposed changes (the "stop
 > naming change" would need some refinement).

Agree'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2019-08-21 16:41:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

We know that folks participated in the process without having read the current document.  I think we just don't have the appetite to deal with this fully and correctly.  It's a lot of work, and we should find something simpler and better so we can spend our limited time happily working together on our favorite software."}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2019-08-21 16:47:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

I understand the reasons to want to move away from the current process. Overall I'm pretty neutral about it.

If we do end up sticking with the current process, then there is of course room for modest improvements within that process. So I've left a suggestion detailing one possible improvement."}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2019-08-21 18:49:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)

Alexandra Settle wrote:

> I agree with Eric, I'm not sure this clarification solves the
> problem. Could you be more verbose on how you see this clarification
> solving what happened for U?

Since many of the problems with the execution of the process for U were that the process was not followed, I do not expect that this would have changed the outcome, which is why I'm voting -1.

If we want to go with this or Zane's further suggestions for changing the process, I think we need to commit to follow the written process closely."}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2019-08-21 20:19:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Perhaps this document should clarify that the TC appointed coordinator must qualify for the role by ensuring they have read this document and have a history of being able to follow documented procedures?'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-08-26 10:58:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1

we could then amend later to "define the geographic region" to "x" (x could be "something the country")'}, {'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2019-11-15 14:37:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

+1 for Anita's suggestion."}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2019-11-15 16:12:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2019-11-15 16:12:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

corvus: I think you have a -1 on this patvh but I'm struggling to see why, I think this change is good to land."}, {'account_id': 10607, 'date': '2019-11-18 16:29:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 10607, 'date': '2019-11-18 16:29:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1 -Workflow'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-12-04 11:55:37.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

Thanks for the proposition!"}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-21 14:45:24.000000000', 'message': 'Clarify the existing release naming process

This process was an attempt to document as fair a process as possible,
but it has repeatedly not been followed to the detriment of the
project overall.  In particular, multiple election officials have
manipulated the lists according to their own preferences in
contravention of the process described here.

Update the text to make this more clear.

Change-Id: I62fc9b81aded6e1bc23fec9f3208d760fbf37cad
'}]
commit_message:
Clarify the existing release naming process

This process was an attempt to document as fair a process as possible,
but it has repeatedly not been followed to the detriment of the
project overall.  In particular, multiple election officials have
manipulated the lists according to their own preferences in
contravention of the process described here.

Update the text to make this more clear.

Change-Id: I62fc9b81aded6e1bc23fec9f3208d760fbf37cad

messages:
[{'account_id': 1, 'date': '2019-08-21 14:43:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10607, 'date': '2019-08-21 14:44:38.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from release-naming to formal-vote'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-08-21 15:14:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Neat idea. According to a very quick analysis of that wiki page (of course assuming it never changes), this would give us the following number of candidates for each letter:

 a 13
 b 24
 c 22
 d 13
 e 1
 f 6
 g 7
 h 13
 i 5
 j 5
 k 17
 l 9
 m 21
 n 10
 o 4
 p 11
 q 5
 r 7
 s 25
 t 15
 u 1
 v 3
 w 3
 x 2
 y 5
 z 3

(I was afraid there would be some zeroes in there)

We'll all have to learn how to spell/pronounce Ekurhuleni; but at least the next 'u' release won't be controversial."}, {'account_id': 8099, 'date': '2019-08-21 15:44:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1

I like this idea - simple, and bounded to a limited set of names'}, {'account_id': 10607, 'date': '2019-08-21 15:47:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

TL;DR Love it. This is what we began with, and what I believe we should continue with. This solution also provides us with the beginnings of "where to go" after Z. 
This makes the most sense to me. 

NOTE: This should not be merged by RC until community has fully reviewed, not just the TC. Providing +1 code review until then.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-08-21 16:31:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2019-08-21 16:38:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

I like this, I would like this more with a consistent release number (e.g. 19.04, year.month). I would like to see an addendum for cases where the name doesn't work; just a simple "exceptional process" such as "in the case that either a city on the list is not available with the starting letter...<something something>, city names not explicitly on the wikipedia list will be considered"; not to change the "name after a city", just give an out for some exceptional cases.'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2019-08-21 19:29:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I see this change as mostly focused on getting us to Z.  This is the most like our current naming paradigm, so is a good choice for maintaining consistency with the previous releases.  After Z is a natural inflection point to change to something else (or change the set of cities).  So I'd suggest mostly evaluating this on the merits of V-Z."}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2019-08-21 19:57:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

This is fine by me. We could also expand the entropy by allowing contributors to propose their local city names.'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2019-08-21 20:05:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

One of the things I'm hoping to achieve here is to avoid having a contributor submit a suggestion and later be told that it will be removed.  If we start heading in that direction, we'll end up back where we are now.  I think the benefit of this is that the list is arbitrary and pre-determined.  I do think it would be fine to change the list if we want (wikipedia has many lists of cities), but I think if we keep it neutral, then we won't waste our time debating criteria and rejecting suggestions."}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2019-08-21 21:51:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I'm not a big fan of this because remembering the location of the summit is pretty much the only way I can keep track of releases. Introducing another unrelated city name into the mix could get confusing. (Counterpoint: Havana)

There is only one city on the list beginning with E or U. That might set us up for problems later."}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2019-08-21 22:23:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

In addition to Havana, there's also Juno.  It was a tradition for a while.  I think the ship has sailed on connection of host cities to release names.

Regarding E or U -- let's also look at this change as something to get us to Z, and leave the post-Z discussion for later."}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-08-22 09:35:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1

I like this. Very 'Casa De Papel'.

- it is pretty deterministic

- it avoids the need for a trademark check (large city names are unlikely to be trademarkable)

- we have largely de-correlated "design summit location" from cycle names already, so the geographic excuse is no longer needed'}, {'account_id': 10607, 'date': '2019-08-22 09:40:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1 -Code-Review

> I like this. Very 'Casa De Papel'.
 > 
 > - it is pretty deterministic
 > 
 > - it avoids the need for a trademark check (large city names are
 > unlikely to be trademarkable)
 > 
This is a really good point.

 > - we have largely de-correlated "design summit location" from cycle
 > names already, so the geographic excuse is no longer needed

True.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-08-22 09:48:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

NB: I'd keep the single-word, 10-letter limit to save typing and typos."}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-08-22 09:51:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Also no names containing single quotes, to avoid script crashes and endless discussions on whether it is culturally acceptable to abbreviate Xi'an to Xian."}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2019-08-22 15:22:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10343, 'date': '2019-08-22 19:46:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1

I also like this option for getting us to Z.

I'm not sure if I like it after Z, due to the limited set of options. But then again, we have at least one choice for each, so this can last for at least 13 years. So maybe, it's fine."}, {'account_id': 6316, 'date': '2019-08-23 21:37:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Let's take a look at exactly what we are considering given the version of the wikipage currently offered.

My eyes see the following options for V, W, X, Y and Z:
Visakhapatnam
Vienna
Vijayawada

Warsaw
Wenzhou
Wuhan

Xiamen
Xi'an

Yangon
Yaoundé
Yekaterinburg
Yerevan
Yokohama

Zhengzhou
Zhongshan
Zunyi

So five selections remain in the getting-to-Z ambition. Right now the only names in the X and Z categories belong to Chinese cities. Two of 3 options in the W category also belong to Chinese cities. Given we have just agreed to a name for U based on a Chinese geographical location, I think this process would be heavily skewed to Chinese names for the remaining 5 releases, not by design by simply by the options available.

I don't think we are going to be accomplishing our goal of being neutral and internationally disseminated if we select this process, given the current version of the wikipedia page. The process itself is a good one, the current reality is slanted too heavily to one country right now. Do we have any alternate suggestions for lists of cities? I do like the list of cities idea, but I would hope the selected list is more equally distributed around the world."}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2019-08-24 10:08:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1 Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

this seems reasonable to me. 

We should not remove the previous coordinator table. so I am -1 as code review but +1 on Rollcall for this idea.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-08-29 11:09:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Regarding the v-z options I think the Condorcet poll protects us from an overdose of Chinese names. Also one might argue that we have not had much Chinese names until now while ~16% of OpenStack contributions are now coming from mainland China, so that would give us the option to add some balance.'}, {'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2019-09-10 15:42:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I like this proposal but I would prefer if the list were taken from the letter-specific Wikipedia page with cities with greater than 100,000 inhabitants.  That would allow for smaller cities with a larger historical or cultural significance.  

Examples:
- https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_towns_and_cities_with_100,000_or_more_inhabitants/cityname:_V
- https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_towns_and_cities_with_100,000_or_more_inhabitants/cityname:_W
- etc.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-09-10 17:49:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Yeah, that might be a better option for V-Z'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-09-11 07:09:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I like this proposal but I would prefer if the list were taken from
 > the letter-specific Wikipedia page with cities with greater than
 > 100,000 inhabitants.  That would allow for smaller cities with a
 > larger historical or cultural significance.
 > 
 > Examples:
 > - https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_towns_and_cities_with_100,000_or_more_inhabitants/cityname:_V
 > - https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_towns_and_cities_with_100,000_or_more_inhabitants/cityname:_W
 > - etc.

I like this idea the best.
Not sure I want to change things before the next A-Z, but that's a different story. We can still start with this, and not change in A-Z :)"}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-09-23 18:41:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote-1'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2019-10-10 14:57:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2019-10-10 14:59:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I had already fired up a separate proposal to this effect: https://review.opendev.org/687764'}, {'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2019-10-10 15:11:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I think that the "TC is the only voting body" part of the proposal should be separated from the "100k cities" part, which is covered in https://review.opendev.org/687764.  That way the merits of having the TC be the decider can be debated separately, which I think is a better way.'}, {'account_id': 6316, 'date': '2019-10-11 00:37:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

Thank you Jim, for addressing the concerns I had outlined in my comment on the prior patchset.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-10-14 12:12:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

@Nate: I'm not sure splitting the proposals into two steps would actually help :) Given the nature of this choice, it's easier to vote on competing, fully-formed proposals."}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2019-10-14 15:38:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

Indeed, I think whether the TC or the wider community is the electorate is the distinguishing characteristic between Nate and my proposals.  I advocate for this one (where the TC is the electorate) because I believe (and several on the TC have said so as well) that running a community-wide election for the name is too much trouble, and that especially with a restricted set of options like this, we can let the TC do what it does best and deliberate and select an option on behalf of the community that elected it.  We are *far* less likely to get into trouble if we ask a set of 13 (or 9) people to use their best judgement.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-10-14 18:42:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2019-10-15 12:51:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Rollcall-Vote+1 -Code-Review

I'm OK with this then"}, {'account_id': 10343, 'date': '2019-10-15 13:38:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I would live by this, but I don't find it particularly fun or engaging for the community."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-10-16 14:41:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

IMO the community, not the TC, should be the electorate.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-10-17 09:50:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Rollcall-Vote+1

Recording my official vote: I prefer my movie quote proposal, and keeping the community vote, but I could live with this. It's better that what we currently have."}, {'account_id': 10607, 'date': '2019-10-17 14:53:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

I agree with Eric on this, but the proposal itself is good.'}, {'account_id': 10343, 'date': '2019-10-17 15:14:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Rollcall-Vote-1

I would prefer that the community voted on this, so I'd rather keep the current process over this proposal. But just barely, so I could be swayed."}, {'account_id': 7198, 'date': '2019-10-17 15:16:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Rollcall-Vote+1

Not my favorite idea as it doesn't include the community.  It does however keep to our tradition to an extent and simplifies things."}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2019-10-17 15:24:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Rollcall-Vote-1

(1 comment)

I also like community vote than TC only poll. major cities idea is good to me.'}, {'account_id': 7198, 'date': '2019-10-17 15:24:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Rollcall-Vote

Removing my rollcall as I think that the version of this that includes the community is more appropriate.'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2019-10-17 15:43:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

IMO, we still need some part from the previous context like ` The Foundation will perform a trademark check...` part'}, {'account_id': 8099, 'date': '2019-10-18 14:20:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-10-28 12:08:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Rollcall-Vote-1

This didn't win over the "stay the same"'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2019-11-15 16:55:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I think we can probably abandon this at this point :<'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-12-04 11:54:27.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

I am closing this. We didn't get consensus in this proposition. We have discussed all together on alternative proposals, and we since then reached consensus on the next steps."}]

commit_message:
Name releases after major cities

This process was an attempt to document as fair a process as possible,
but it has repeatedly not been followed to the detriment of the
project overall.  Moreover, due to our growing international
community, it is becoming more difficult to find appropriate names.

Change the process to involve fewer choices so that the TC simply
chooses from a pre-determined list of neutral choices.  It is less
interesting but there is less to go wrong.

Note: this process relies entirely on the TC -- the TC is the voting
electorate which chooses the name, and also decides when to start
the process.  This makes it simple and lightweight and not subject
to nearly as many surprises.

This process is intended to apply for all new releases, including
after the Z rollover.

Change-Id: Ie8ff829e3e1cb8a5a39c4f8df8db037f3fc9b254

[{'created': '2019-12-04 09:49:57.000000000', 'message': 'Remove alembic migrations entry points for networking-ovn

During merging of networking-ovn code into neutron repo we added
in neutron db migration script to create ovn tables if they not exists
yet. It's in [1].
That broke CI for e.g. networking-ovn and tripleo, where neutron and
networking-ovn from master branch are used. It happens because neutron's
db migration scripts are run first, so it creates ovn related tables
and than networking-ovn migration script fails with error "Table x
already exists".

So lets not register alembic migration entry points for networking-ovn
project anymore as it is now added in Neutron directly.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/695969/

Change-Id: I886cd93ebf36c3fbca14e4534bf36041660e97b8
Closes-Bug: #1855063
'}]
commit_message:
Remove alembic migrations entry points for networking-ovn

During merging of networking-ovn code into neutron repo we added
in neutron db migration script to create ovn tables if they not exists
yet. It's in [1].
That broke CI for e.g. networking-ovn and tripleo, where neutron and
networking-ovn from master branch are used. It happens because neutron's
db migration scripts are run first, so it creates ovn related tables
and than networking-ovn migration script fails with error "Table x
already exists".

So lets not register alembic migration entry points for networking-ovn
project anymore as it is now added in Neutron directly.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/695969/

Change-Id: I886cd93ebf36c3fbca14e4534bf36041660e97b8
Closes-Bug: #1855063

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-03 08:13:26.000000000', 'message': '[OVS FW] Clean port rules if port not found in ovsdb

During e.g. migration or shelve of VM it may happend that
port update event will be send to the ovs agent and in the almost
the same time, port will be removed from br-int.
In such case during update_port_filter method openvswitch firewall
driver will not find port in br-int, and it will do nothing with it.
That will lead to leftover rules for this port in br-int.

So this patch adds calling remove_port_filter() method if port was
not found in br-int. Just to be sure that there is no any leftovers
from the port in br-int anymore.

Change-Id: I06036ce5fe15d91aa440dc340a70dd27ae078c53
Closes-Bug: #1850557
(cherry picked from commit b01e0c2aa98866df9c25e20a66c02fccccdc7885)
'}]
commit_message:
[OVS FW] Clean port rules if port not found in ovsdb

During e.g. migration or shelve of VM it may happend that
port update event will be send to the ovs agent and in the almost
the same time, port will be removed from br-int.
In such case during update_port_filter method openvswitch firewall
driver will not find port in br-int, and it will do nothing with it.
That will lead to leftover rules for this port in br-int.

So this patch adds calling remove_port_filter() method if port was
not found in br-int. Just to be sure that there is no any leftovers
from the port in br-int anymore.

Change-Id: I06036ce5fe15d91aa440dc340a70dd27ae078c53
Closes-Bug: #1850557
(cherry picked from commit b01e0c2aa98866df9c25e20a66c02fccccdc7885)

commit_message:
Move OVN "fakes" test helper

The fakes.py file in networking-ovn is a collection of helper functions
and classes to help with testing OVN.

Previous paths in networking-ovn tree:
./networking-ovn/networking_ovn/tests/unit/fakes.py ->
./neutron/tests/common/ovn_fakes.py

Change-Id: Iec441d8095e74d897fc3164e57d2f35d9b9d581c
Related-Blueprint: neutron-ovn-merge
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

OVNTrunkDriver update neutron port from OVNTrunkHandler

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-12 16:03:00.000000000', 'message': "Fix AttributeError in negotiate_version

TODO: decide what to do here.

Seen in kolla-ansible CI, if ironic inspector starts up before ironic
API is properly up, we see the following error:

The PXE filter DnsmasqFilter, state=initialized encountered an
exception: StrictVersion instance has no attribute 'version'; resetting
the filter: AttributeError: StrictVersion instance has no attribute
'version'

Example: http://paste.openstack.org/show/756342/

Googling suggests the usual cause of this error is when StrictVersion is
initialised with a version of None. This suggests to me that max_ver is
None.

This patch catches the case where we were unable to find a version in
the response headers.

Change-Id: Ib62ca3ee4626084e5e9b90e93e4fa97938023457
Story: 2006393
Task: 36266
"}, {'created': '2019-09-10 15:13:54.000000000', 'message': "Fix AttributeError in negotiate_version

the filter: AttributeError: StrictVersion instance has no attribute
'version'

Example: http://paste.openstack.org/show/756342/

The usual cause of this error is when StrictVersion is initialised with
a version of None. This suggests to me that max_ver is None.

This patch catches the case where we get a 4xx or 5xx return code when
checking the version, and raises an error.

Change-Id: Ib62ca3ee4626084e5e9b90e93e4fa97938023457
Story: 2006393

"}, {'created': '2019-11-22 17:43:49.000000000', 'message': "Fix AttributeError in negotiate_version

Seen in kolla-ansible CI, if ironic inspector starts up before ironic
API is properly up, we see the following error:

The PXE filter DnsmasqFilter, state=initialized encountered an
exception: StrictVersion instance has no attribute 'version'; resetting
the filter: AttributeError: StrictVersion instance has no attribute
'version'

Example: http://paste.openstack.org/show/756342/

The usual cause of this error is when StrictVersion is initialised with
a version of None. This suggests to me that max_ver is None.

This leads to an exception being raised that circumvents the client's
retry mechanisms.

In the particular case of kolla-ansible CI, Ironic API is behind a load
balancer, and all backends are down resulting in a 503. The lack of a
retry caused ironic inspector to fail on startup.

This patch catches the case where we get a 4xx or 5xx return code when
checking the version, and raises an error that works with the client's
retry mechanisms.

Change-Id: Ib62ca3ee4626084e5e9b90e93e4fa97938023457
Story: 2006393
Task: 36266

commit_message:
Fix AttributeError in negotiate_version

Seen in kolla-ansible CI, if ironic inspector starts up before ironic
API is properly up, we see the following error:

The PXE filter DnsmasqFilter, state=initialized encountered an
exception: StrictVersion instance has no attribute 'version'; resetting
the filter: AttributeError: StrictVersion instance has no attribute
'version'

Example: http://paste.openstack.org/show/756342/

The usual cause of this error is when StrictVersion is initialised with
a version of None. This suggests to me that max_ver is None.

This leads to an exception being raised that circumvents the client's
retry mechanisms.

In the particular case of kolla-ansible CI, Ironic API is behind a load
balancer, and all backends are down resulting in a 503. The lack of a
retry caused ironic inspector to fail on startup.

This patch catches the case where we get a 4xx or 5xx return code when
checking the version, and raises an error that works with the client's
retry mechanisms.

Change-Id: Ib62ca3ee4626084e5e9b90e93e4fa97938023457
Story: 2006393
Task: 36266

commit_message:
Increading a timeout to 120 seconds on CRD creation

This is needed because it takes time to update Network resources
(for example LB or SG) after Network policy creation

Change-Id: I9b234386d861dfd35ed2062f7951dbe15538a034

[{'created': '2019-11-29 19:40:45.000000000', 'message': "Fix Swift with kernel 4.19 and later

We mount Swift volumes with xfs.
The 'nobarrier' option we used was made noop [1]
and deprecated [2] in kernel 4.19.
In 4.19 it was removed [3] resulting in an error
when using e.g. Debian Buster as host.
The noop patch was backported to CentOS 7 so
it is safe to remove this option with no behavior
change and backport to where needed.
Ubuntu Bionic uses 4.15 which only warns.
CentOS 8 uses 4.18 which only warns as well.
Debian Buster uses 4.19 exactly which breaks.

[1] https://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/commit/?id=2291dab2c9d1880efd19469df2042e2277c8b7a4
[2] https://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/commit/?id=4cf4573d899cd80d8578c050061dc342f99f3a32
[3] https://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/commit/?id=1c02d502c20809a2a5f71ec16a930a61ed779b81

Change-Id: I006dea21321146c7fc738d0b41c401b72d271a99
Closes-bug: #1800132
"}, {'created': '2019-11-30 11:57:28.000000000', 'message': "Fix Swift with kernel 4.19 and later

commit_message:
Fix Swift with kernel 4.19 and later

We mount Swift volumes with xfs.
The 'nobarrier' option we used was made noop [1]
and deprecated [2] (with warning) in kernel 4.10.
In 4.19 it was removed [3] resulting in an error
when using e.g. Debian Buster as host.
The noop patch was backported to CentOS 7 so
it is safe to remove this option with no behavior
change and backport to where needed.
Ubuntu Bionic uses 4.15 which only warns.
CentOS 8 uses 4.18 which only warns as well.
Debian Buster uses 4.19 exactly which breaks.

[1] https://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/commit/?id=2291dab2c9d1880efd19469df2042e2277c8b7a4
[2] https://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/commit/?id=4cf4573d899cd80d8578c050061dc342f99f3a32
[3] https://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/commit/?id=1c02d502c20809a2a5f71ec16a930a61ed779b81

Change-Id: I006dea21321146c7fc738d0b41c401b72d271a99
Closes-bug: #1800132

commit_message:
Fix tenant floating_ip_allocation call in neutron rest api.

The call to allocate a new floating IP was incorrecting calling
tenant_floating_ip_allocate, this is used by neutron-lbaas-dashboard.

Change-Id: Ia4d1367ccd309a074a0ea84a555d7de6c07971a6
Closes-bug: #1831954
(cherry picked from commit 92d832028df65cb95030b2a585764a62dc1c0b75)

(cherry picked from commit c5f9ea959092019aa44eb96224fd365b8025bba6)

subject: Sync up upgrades and updates workarounds mechanism.
messages: [{'account_id': 11166, 'date': '2019-11-13 19:12:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11166, 'date': '2019-11-14 09:32:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11166, 'date': '2019-11-14 13:34:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 11166, 'date': '2019-11-22 14:48:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 11166, 'date': '2019-11-22 16:24:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 11166, 'date': '2019-11-25 11:24:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6: Patch Set 5 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 11166, 'date': '2019-11-25 14:44:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2019-11-26 17:02:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 11166, 'date': '2019-12-03 13:25:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8: Patch Set 7 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 11166, 'date': '2019-12-04 09:38:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-13 19:12:47.000000000', 'message': 'Sync up upgrades and updates workarounds mechanism.

Up to now, the minor updates workarounds was not being used very much
being a little bit left away in comparision with what it was implemented
for the upgrades one. This patch allows minor updates to benefit from
the same workarounds mechanism, at the same time that any improvement
in the upgrades mechanism will be available for updates too.

Also, it was removed the references to the {{ working_dir }} variable
in those shell tasks which have the argument changing directory to that
very same {{ working_dir }}, mostly to simplify the tasks and remove
redundancy.

commit_message:
Sync up upgrades and updates workarounds mechanism.

Up to now, the minor updates workarounds was not being used very much
being a little bit left away in comparision with what it was implemented
for the upgrades one. This patch allows minor updates to benefit from
the same workarounds mechanism, at the same time that any improvement
in the upgrades mechanism will be available for updates too.

Also, it was removed the references to the {{ working_dir }} variable
in those shell tasks which have the argument changing directory to that
very same {{ working_dir }}, mostly to simplify the tasks and remove
redundancy.

Change-Id: Ibc57c51ff19ebad093c887bee545ca6a7d51827f
(cherry picked from commit ef1545650338f9e70bd98e18a2517e63e23cd0a9)

commit_message:
Use yaml.SafeLoader instead of yaml.FullLoader

Because we don't need to use yaml.FullLoader, use yaml.SafeLoder
so that we can keep compability with PyYAML < 5.1 .

Change-Id: I51e700f5ad3364c5c8a26aa79b44cd8da1ec469d
(cherry picked from commit ade6c3b37e5716a88db6b189a4e8809cd9206218)

commit_message:
Add image data for instance with volume

If an instance was created with a volume from an image, there is
no image details in instance overview page.
This patch adds image info from volume image-metadata.

Change-Id: I1da69eb4a65ab13f77d610b870bada994de876f2
Closes-Bug: 1833267
